The **wand of fire** is a [wand](/wiki/Wand "Wand") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Generation](#Generation)

- [2 Effects](#Effects)

- [3 Strategy](#Strategy)

- [4 History](#History)

- [5 Variants](#Variants)

  - [5.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [5.2 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [5.3 FIQHack](#FIQHack)
  - [5.4 NetHack Fourk](#NetHack_Fourk)

- [6 References](#References)

## Generation

A [Wizard](/wiki/Wizard "Wizard") may receive a wand of fire as part of their starting inventory.

There is a 4% chance that a [randomly-generated wand](/wiki/Wand#Generation "Wand") within the dungeon and its branches will be a wand of fire. Monsters may generate with the wand as a random [offensive item](/wiki/Offensive_item "Offensive item").

[Asmodeus](/wiki/Asmodeus "Asmodeus") [will always generate with](/wiki/Monster_starting_inventory "Monster starting inventory") a [wand of cold](/wiki/Wand_of_cold "Wand of cold") and a wand of fire.[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)[\[2\]](#cite_note-2)

## Effects

[Zapping](/wiki/Zap "Zap") the wand in a given direction emits a [ray](/wiki/Ray "Ray") of fire that does 6d6 damage to non-[fire resistant](/wiki/Fire_resistance "Fire resistance") targets, with a +7 bonus if the monster has [cold resistance](/wiki/Cold_resistance "Cold resistance").[\[3\]](#cite_note-3) Monsters hit with this ray may have their inventory set aflame: [potions](/wiki/Potions "Potions") may boil, [scrolls](/wiki/Scrolls "Scrolls") and [spellbooks](/wiki/Spellbooks "Spellbooks") may burn, and organic [armor](/wiki/Armor "Armor") may smoulder. The ray bounces when it hits walls or targets with [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection"); it can melt any squares of [ice](/wiki/Ice "Ice") it travels over, destroy any [doors](/wiki/Door "Door") it colid and evaporates [pools](/wiki/Pool "Pool") of water.

[Engraving](/wiki/Engraving "Engraving") with a wand of fire will [auto-identify](/wiki/Auto-identify "Auto-identify") the wand.

*The following information pertains to an upcoming version ([3.7.0](/wiki/3.7.0 "3.7.0")). If this version is now released, please verify that it is still accurate, then update the page to incorporate this information.*

Rays of fire that partially or completely evaporate pools or moats will generate [clouds](/wiki/Cloud "Cloud") of steam.

## Strategy

- *See also: [Wand strategy](/wiki/Wand_strategy "Wand strategy")*

The wand of fire is a useful offensive item against most monsters that can prove just as deadly to you, especially early on where you typically lack a source of [reflection](/wiki/Reflection "Reflection") or fire resistance. It can be especially deadly against vulnerable monsters if you have a means of rebounding or reflecting the ray back at them.

A wand of fire is a popular means of engraving [Elbereth](/wiki/Elbereth "Elbereth") - such engravings are permanent and can only be removed by making it vanish (with a [wand of cancellation](/wiki/Wand_of_cancellation "Wand of cancellation"), wand of cold or [make invisible](/wiki/Wand_of_make_invisible "Wand of make invisible")), [teleporting it](/wiki/Wand_of_teleportation "Wand of teleportation"), [polymorphing it](/wiki/Wand_of_polymorph "Wand of polymorph"), or overwriting it (with a [wand of lightning](/wiki/Wand_of_lightning "Wand of lightning") or another wand of fire). The wand can also be used to destroy the [door](/wiki/Door "Door") to the [Sokoban](/wiki/Sokoban "Sokoban") zoo without waking up *all* of its inhabitants.

In addition to holding off tougher hostiles, wands of fire can also be used to cut them off or dispose of them directly - you can lure an earthbound monster onto ice (e.g. moats frozen with a wand of cold) and then zap a wand of fire to melt it from beneath them, drowning them instantly. Beware, though: monsters using this wand can possibly do the same to you, which is a danger for [Valkyries](/wiki/Valkyrie "Valkyrie") on their [quest](/wiki/Valkyrie_quest "Valkyrie quest") in particular. A wand of fire can also be used to strand [sea monsters](/wiki/Sea_monster "Sea monster") and prevent drowning from [giant eels](/wiki/Giant_eel "Giant eel") or [electric eels](/wiki/Electric_eel "Electric eel"), though this only works if the monster is in a moat.

In an emergency where you are afflicted with [sliming](/wiki/Sliming "Sliming"), zapping the wand at yourself can save you - though it may also damage your armor and inventory, it is much preferable to ending your game as a slime.

## History

The wand of fire has been present in the game since Hack 1.21, a variant of [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack").

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

In [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), [Flame Mages](/wiki/Flame_Mage "Flame Mage") start the game with a wand of fire.

[Grund's Stronghold](/wiki/Grund%27s_Stronghold "Grund's Stronghold") has a [hobgoblin](/wiki/Hobgoblin "Hobgoblin") with a wand of fire in the open area, and the [soldier](/wiki/Soldier "Soldier") that appears in the front corridors has a 60% chance of being generated with a wand of fire.

### SlashTHEM

In [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM"), on top [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") changes, all [Firefighters](/wiki/Firefighter "Firefighter") start with a wand of fire.

### FIQHack

In [FIQHack](/wiki/FIQHack "FIQHack"), which incorporates the [Wands Balance Patch](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"), unskilled usage of a wand of fire chooses the lesser of two values to deal as damage: 3d6 or 40% max HP damage.

### NetHack Fourk

In [NetHack Fourk](/wiki/NetHack_Fourk "NetHack Fourk"), which incorporates the [Wands Balance Patch](/wiki/Wands_Balance_Patch "Wands Balance Patch"), unskilled usage of a wand of fire also chooses the lesser of two values to deal as damage: 3d6 or 40% max HP damage.

## References

1. [↑](#cite_ref-1) [makemon.c in NetHack 3.4.3, line 643](/wiki/Source:NetHack_3.4.3/makemon.c#line643 "Source:NetHack 3.4.3/makemon.c")
2. [↑](#cite_ref-2) [src/makemon.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 772](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/makemon.c#L772)
3. [↑](#cite_ref-3) [src/zap.c in NetHack 3.6.6, line 3629](https://github.com/NetHack/NetHack/blob/NetHack-3.6.6_Released/src/zap.c#L3629)
